contentrichtext.text: {{For|the 2000s Saab 9-2X|Subaru Impreza (second generation)}} {{Notability|Products|date=February 2012}} {{Infobox automobile | image = Saab wordmark grey.svg | name = Saab 9-2 | aka = Saab 9-1 | manufacturer = [[Saab Automobile]] | production = Cancelled due to bankruptcy | class = [[Compact car|Compact]] |predecessor=[[Saab 9-2X]] |layout =[[FF layout]] | body_style = }} The '''Saab 9-2''' (or sometimes referred to as Saab 9-1) was a car that was proposed in 2010 be added to Saab's production line by 2014,<ref>http://www.insideline.com/saab/saab-92-coming-for-2014.html</ref><ref>{{cite news| url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/business/8512224.stm | work=BBC News | title=Spyker boss outlines Saab plans | date=2010-02-12 | accessdate=2010-05-23}}</ref> under its then new ownership, [[Spyker Cars]]<ref>http://www.motorauthority.com/blog/1044019_victor-muller-new-saab-9-2-on-the-drawing-board</ref> though some commentators considered the project a pipe dream.<ref>{{cite web|title=Saab 9-2, just a pipe dream?|url=http://www.autoweek.com/article/20100409/carnews/100409825|work=Auto Week|accessdate=21 August 2012|date=9 April 2010}}</ref> The 9-2 was thought to developed in a joint venture with another automaker, probably European. Although little is known about the design, those who have seen it report it is the same [[Teardrop trailer|teardrop shape]] as the 1949–1956 [[Saab 92]], but also futuristic with the front similar to the new [[Saab 9-5]].<ref>http://blogs.motortrend.com/6661914/corporate/exclusive-victor-muller-shows-us-new-saab-92-sketch-calls-it-top-priority/index.html/</ref> Saab Managing Director Jan-Åke Jonsson said the model would likely not be on the global [[GM Gamma platform]].<ref>{{cite web | last = Bergman | first = Björn | date = 2008-10-01 | url = http://www.automotorsport.se/news/15729/saab-planerar-9-1-p%C3%A5-egen-plattform/ | title = Saab planerar 9-1 på egen plattform | work = Auto Motor & Sport| accessdate = 2009-08-24}}</ref> Speculation in 2009 suggested that the new small Saab would be based on the [[Saab 9-X Biohybrid]] [[concept car]] shown at the 2008 [[Geneva Auto Show]], and expected to compete with other premium small cars such as the [[Mini (BMW)|Mini]].<ref>{{cite web | last = Lassa | first = Todd | date = 2008-02-12 | url = http://www.motortrend.com/future/112_0804_gm_mini_fighter/index.html | title = Small, cool -- it's GM's Mini: Is it a Saturn? A Saab? Both? | work = Motor Trend | accessdate = 2009-08-24}}</ref> == References == {{Reflist}} {{Saab automobiles}} {{Saab Automobile}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Saab 9-2}} [[Category:Saab vehicles|9-2]] [[Category:Compact cars]] [[fi:Saab 9-2]]
